claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination can broaden tumor antigen presentation and enhance visibility to T cells via MHC-I pathways.

evidence.quote: | Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome | 62.3% | 37.3% | Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination |
| Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape |

claims.caveat: The report presents pooled preclinical findings and does not specify whether these gains are uniform across every model tested.

claims.claim: The intervention induces an interferon-rich state that is linked to mechanistic sensitization to checkpoint blockade.

evidence.quote: | Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors |
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: A causal mediation chain is proposed from expression changes to outcome, but human data are retrospective and observational.

claims.claim: Type I interferon signaling appears necessary for the sensitization effect because anti-IFNAR1 blockade removes benefit.

evidence.quote: Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: The report indicates directional loss of effect with IFNAR1 blockade, but does not provide quantitative magnitude of that loss.

claims.claim: In the human retrospective cohort, prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination was associated with improved ICI outcomes compared with no prior vaccination.

evidence.quote: | Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment |
Human retrospective metastatic cohort: 130 patients total.

claims.caveat: The authors caution this analysis is retrospective and non-randomized, so residual confounding and selection bias may influence observed associations.

claims.claim: Combined mRNA vaccine and anti-PD-L1 intervention improved tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the human cohort.

evidence.quote: Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.
Preclinical arm: multiple murine tumor models with intratumoral mRNA vaccine and anti-PD-L1 combinations.

claims.caveat: The human translational signal is retrospective, while the mouse arm is preclinical, so the combined causal interpretation is suggestive not definitive.
